vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
στᾰτήρ, ῆρος, ὁ,
(ἵστημι [Refs 5th c.BC+]; σ. Αἰγιναῖος as a weight, [Refs 5th c.BC+]
__II standard coin, struck in various materials, whether gold, electrum, or silver:
__II.1 gold, σ. χρυσοῖ, σ. χρυσοῦ, [Refs 5th c.BC+]; of various standards, e.g. σ. Δαρεικός (compare Δαρεικός) [Refs 5th c.BC+]; σ. Φιλίππειος, Ἀλεξάνδρειος, [Refs 4th c.BC+]; Πτολεμαϊκὸς σ. [Refs 2nd c.BC+]
__II.2 electrum [Refs 5th c.BC+]; at Phocaea, σ. Φωκαϊται, Φωκαιῆς, [Refs 5th c.BC+]
__II.3 silver, σ. Αἰγιναῖοι [Refs 5th c.BC+]; in Sicily called δεκάλιτρος σ., [Refs 5th c.BC+]; later applied to the Attic τετράδραχμον, [Refs 9th c.AD+]; also to the Ptolemaic τ., [Refs 3rd c.BC+] “*Geometry texts” 23.55,56; also of the Jewish shekel, [NT]
__III one who owes money, debtor, πολλοὶ σ., ἀποδοτῆρες οὐδ᾽ ἂν εἷς (οὐδαμεῖ conjecture Kaibel) [Refs 5th c.BC+]
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
four-drachma coin, stater (four days’ wages)
primarily a weight; a stater, an Attic silver coin, equal in value to the Jewish shekel, or to four Attic or two Alexandrian drachmas, Mt. 17:27*
vocabInfos._es_Definition: estáter, cuatro dracmas (moneda griega con un valor equivalente a dos didracmas o cuatro denarios)
